title: Erin Patterson Gets Life for Murdering 3 Relatives with Poisonous Mushrooms
snippets: An Australian judge sentenced triple-murderer Erin Patterson to life in prison with a non-parole period of 33 years for poisoning four of her estranged husband's relatives with death cap mushrooms.
Australian mother Erin Patterson has been sentenced to a minimum of 33 years in prison for murdering three of her former
Judge says Patterson showed no remorse after serving her in-laws a meal of Beef Wellington laced with toxic mushrooms.
The judge handed out a non-parole period of 33 years to Erin Patterson for poisoning four of her estranged husband's relatives with death cap mushrooms.
Erin Patterson was convicted of killing three relatives with a lunch laced with death cap mushrooms. The judge called her actions “an enormous betrayal of trust.”
Erin Patterson was found guilty of murdering three of her husband’s relatives and trying to kill a fourth by serving them deadly mushrooms.
Triple murderer sentenced in Victorian supreme court after killing relatives with a beef wellington lunch laced with death cap mushrooms

Erin Patterson has been sentenced to life in prison with a non-parole period of 33 years after murdering three people and attempting to murder a fourth with a lunch laced with death cap mushrooms. Patterson, 50, was found guilty of murdering Don and Gail Patterson – the parents of her estranged h
titles: Australian woman is sentenced to life for poisoning relatives with mushrooms
Australia mushroom murderer sentenced to life imprisonment
Australia ‘mushroom murderer’ Erin Patterson sentenced to life in prison
Australia: 'Mushroom murderer' sentenced to life in prison

Australia mushroom murderer Erin Patterson sentenced to life in prison with a non-parole period of 33 years
Erin Patterson: Australia's mushroom murderer sentenced to life in prison – video
summary: Erin Patterson was sentenced to life in prison with a minimum non-parole period of 33 years by an Australian court for murdering three of her estranged husband's relatives and attempting to murder a fourth by serving them a meal containing death cap mushrooms. The judge noted Patterson showed no remorse for her actions, which were described as a significant betrayal of trust.

title: Alcaraz Wins Second US Open, Regains World No. 1 Ranking
snippets: Carlos Alcaraz triumphs in the latest chapter of his compelling rivalry with Jannik Sinner, earning a four-set victory to regain the US Open title.
Alcaraz returns to number one spot after winning his sixth Grand Slam title and second of 2025 in four sets in New York.

By beating Jannik Sinner in four sets, Carlos Alcaraz once again becomes the world's number one tennis player. The US Open final was delayed due to tightened security measures owing to the presence of Donald Trump.

Carlos Alcaraz reasserted his superiority over Jannik Sinner with a 6-2, 3-6, 6-1, 6-4 win Sunday in the US Open final -- the third Grand Slam tournament in a row in which these rivals met to decide a champion -- for his second title at Flushing Meadows.

• Spaniard wins final 6-2, 3-6, 6-1, 6-4

  • Alcaraz new world No 1 after victory

When Carlos Alcaraz is fully focused and his impossibly complete game is in full flow, nothing in the world can stop him. As he has spent the early years of his career collecting maj
Carlos Alcaraz enjoyed the double of winning the U.S. Open and displacing Jannik Sinner as the world No. 1 on Sunday. Sinner had no answer to Alcaraz's box of tricks.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMikAFBVV95cUxPU0lVeThuNXFSbHBFTkJxMmVBaWJiYUYxRDB0cWx5RHNBeXZaSUxwblFUc0s3MHJfWjI3VWlYTFdGbXFRZzZCVEhuZU9uYkNOQ3U0aDM4U2NwYUF2YW5PZktuNGpCYy1mVXY2RjE0MkVMem5EUGw5cTIzeGVXS2Y2eEdIZW1MSXJKaVdCSGFTSkw?oc=5" target="_blank">Carlos Alcaraz Wins Trilogy Matc
Carlos Alcaraz dethroned Jannik Sinner in sensational fashion to seal his second US Open title and become new world No 1 after security delays frustrated fans.

summary: Carlos Alcaraz defeated Jannik Sinner in four sets (6-2, 3-6, 6-1, 6-4) to win his second US Open title and his sixth Grand Slam. This victory in New York also returned Alcaraz to the world number one ranking. The final, which marked the third consecutive Grand Slam final between Alcaraz and Sinner, experienced delays due to heightened security measures.

title: Israel's Supreme Court Orders Better Food for Palestinian Prisoners
snippets: The court said the state is legally obligated to provide enough food to ensure "a basic level of existence."
Israel's highest court says Palestinian prisoners are being deliberately starved in harsh prison conditions.

The High Court of Justice found that Palestinian prisoners were not receiving sufficient food and ordered that more be supplied. Meanwhile, Trump issues a "last warning" to Hamas to accept ceasefire deal. DW has more.

Justices rule state is legally obliged to ensure ‘basic level of existence’ and orders authorities to improve nutrition

Israel’s supreme court has ruled that the government has failed to provide Palestinian security prisoners with adequate food for basic subsistence and ordered authorities
titles: Palestinian prisoners not being given adequate food, Israel top court says
Israel depriving Palestinian prisoners of food, its Supreme Court rules
Israel court demands more food for Palestinian prisoners
Israel’s top court says government is not giving Palestinian prisoners enough food
summary: Israel's Supreme Court ruled that the government must provide Palestinian prisoners with adequate food to ensure a basic level of existence, finding current provisions insufficient. This decision mandates authorities to improve nutrition for these prisoners. Concurrently, Trump issued a "last warning" to Hamas to accept a ceasefire deal, although this aspect is separate from the court's ruling.

title: South Korea to Repatriate 300 Workers Detained in ICE Raid at Hyundai-LG in Geor
snippets: More than 300 South Korean workers were detained in an immigration raid on Thursday. Presidential chief of staff Kang Hoon-sik said South Korea plans to send a charter plane to bring the workers home.
The South Korean government said on Sunday that it would send a charter plane to the United States to retrieve hundreds of workers detained in an immigration raid.
South Korea says it has a deal for release of those caught in Hyundai Georgia raid.

Footage of raid by US immigration officials showed detained workers in handcuffs and with chains around their ankles

South Korea announced on Sunday that the roughly 300 of its nationals detained during an immigration raid in Georgia would be released and flown home, as the sudden detention
titles: South Korea says it has reached a deal with the US for the release of workers in a Georgia plant

summary: Over 300 South Korean workers were detained in the largest ICE raid of Trump's administration at a Hyundai-LG site in Georgia. South Korea announced plans to repatriate the workers, stating a charter plane will be sent to the U.S. once administrative procedures are completed. The South Korean government's action follows the significant immigration enforcement operation, highlighting its commitment to assisting its nationals abroad.

title: Lamar Jackson Regrets Shoving Fan After Helmet Slap Incident
snippets: During Sunday night's 41-40 loss to the Buffalo Bills in the season opener, Baltimore Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson shoved a fan who slapped Jackson on the helmet. "I just let my emotions get the best of me," Jackson later told reporters.
DeAndre Hopkins also got slapped on the helmet by the same fan just before Jackson did
Watch as a Bills fan hits DeAndre Hopkins and Lamar Jackson as they celebrate their touchdown, and the Ravens’ QB responds with a shove of his own in the stands.
titles: Jackson shoves fan in retaliation in Ravens' loss
Lamar Jackson shoves Bills fan in retaliation for getting slapped on helmet following Ravens TD in Buffalo

summary: During the season opener against the Buffalo Bills, Baltimore Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson and teammate DeAndre Hopkins were slapped on the helmet by a fan while celebrating a touchdown. Jackson responded by shoving the fan. Jackson later expressed regret, stating his emotions got the best of him.

title: Japan PM Ishiba Resigns After Election Loss, Aims to Unite Party
snippets: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has expressed his intention on Sunday to step down following growing calls from his party to take responsibility for a historic defeat in July's parliamentary election.
Shigeru Ishiba's ruling coalition suffered a historic setback in national elections in July.
Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba over the weekend announced he will resign.
Ishiba had faced calls for his resignation after the ruling Liberal Democratic Party failed to secure a majority in the lower house election on Oct. 27.
The embattled leader is trying to head off a deep split in his party over a right-wing political surge, a weakened economy and turbulent trade relations with the United States.
Japan, one of the world’s most stable democracies, is experiencing unusually rapid change. Shigeru Ishiba’s departure could herald a leadership crisis.
titles: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba to resign
Japanese Prime Minister Ishiba announces resignation
Japanese stocks jump as Prime Minister Ishiba set to step down
Japan Prime Minister Ishiba Shigeru says he will step down after election setback
Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba of Japan Says He Will Step Down
Japan’s Prime Minister, Shigeru Ishiba, Resigns: What to Know
summary: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has announced his resignation due to pressure from his party after a significant defeat in the July parliamentary elections. His decision aims to prevent a split in the Liberal Democratic Party, following criticism over handling the economy, a right-wing political rise, and strained U.S. trade relations. Ishiba, who took office with promises of revitalizing Japan and addressing demographic challenges, faced further calls for resignation after failing to secure a majority in the October 27 lower house election.

title: Carlo Acutis Canonized as First Millennial Saint by Pope Leo XIV
snippets: 'Cyber-apostle' Carlo Acutis, who died of leukaemia in 2006 aged just 15, was officially canonized at the Vatican on Sunday. Pope Leo said he was happy to see many young Catholics attending the ceremony.
Pope Leo XIV has declared a 15-year-old computer whiz the Catholic Church's first millennial saint.

London-born Italian, who died in 2006, built websites to spread Catholic teaching and is credited with two miracles

A London-born Italian teenage computer whiz who died in 2006 age 15, has been declared the Catholic church’s first millennial saint during an open-air mass in a packed St Pete
Carlo, who died at 15, was canonized alongside Pier Giorgio Frassati, who also died young. The church is looking to the two saints to inspire new generations of Catholics.
titles: Vatican: 'God's influencer' declared first millennial saint
WATCH:  Teen influencer becomes Catholic Church's 1st millennial saint

Carlo Acutis, Known as ‘God’s Influencer,’ Is Declared a Saint by Pope Leo XIV
summary: Carlo Acutis, a London-born Italian teenager who died of leukemia in 2006 at age 15, was canonized by Pope Leo XIV at the Vatican, becoming the Catholic Church's first millennial saint. Known as "God's influencer" and a "cyber-apostle," Acutis used his computer skills to document and spread Catholic teachings, particularly about miracles. His canonization, celebrated in an open-air mass attended by many young Catholics, highlights his role as a relatable figure for new generations, emphasizing his blend of typical teenage interests and devout faith. Acutis is credited with two miracles since h

title: Thousands Rally Across Brazil Amid Bolsonaro Trial Countdown
snippets: Thousands march in support of and against Brazil's former president ahead of Supreme Court decision on coup attempt.

Thousands gathered to show their support for Jair Bolsonaro in the cities of Sao Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Porto Alegre and Brasilia. The former Brazilian president is accused of trying to overturn the 2022 election result.
Tensions are heating up in Brazil as the nation enters the final week of former President Jair Bolsonaro’s trial on attempted coup charges.
titles: Huge crowds rally for Brazil’s Bolsonaro ahead of verdict in coup trial
Brazil: Bolsonaro backers rally ahead of coup trial verdict
Brazilians Protest as Bolsonaro Coup Trial Nears Verdict
summary: Thousands rallied in Sao Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Porto Alegre, and Brasilia, both supporting and opposing former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, as his trial for attempting to overturn the 2022 election result approaches its final week.

title: "Blood Moon Eclipse Enchants Viewers from Australia to Europe"
snippets: A total lunar eclipse brought a 'blood moon' over Asia, Europe, and Africa as stargazers marvelled at the sight.

Visible from Australia, across Asia, to western Europe, a blood moon has been captivating stargazers. This marvel is caused when the Earth shades the moon from direct solar light, causing the moon to appear red
Stargazers enjoyed a "Blood Moon" Sunday night during a total lunar eclipse visible across Asia and swaths of Europe and Africa.
titles: ‘Blood moon’ rises during total lunar eclipse
Blood moon and lunar eclipse cast an ethereal light – in pictures
'Blood Moon' rises during total lunar eclipse
summary: A total lunar eclipse resulted in a "Blood Moon," captivating viewers across Asia, Europe, and Africa. This phenomenon occurs when Earth blocks direct sunlight from reaching the moon, making it appear red. The event was visible from Australia to western Europe, attracting attention from stargazers worldwide.

title: Lady Gaga Tops 2025 MTV VMAs Nominations; Mariah Carey Honored

Singers took home two trophies each as Mariah Carey won a lifetime achievement award, in a night that largely celebrated female artists

The VMAs were broadcast live across CBS, MTV, and Paramount+, with key winners including Video of the Year and Artist of the Year announced during the show.

title: Hundreds Detained in US Raid on Hyundai, 300 South Koreans to be Repatriated
snippets: Some 400 US agents took part in the immigration raid on the Hyundai facility, detaining hundreds of workers, many South Korean nationals.

South Korea has said that 300 of its nationals detained during the immigration raid would be flown home. Key US politics stories from Sunday 7 September at a glance

"What we ask in return is that you hire and train American Workers," Trump wrote on Truth Social.

South Korea announced that 300 of its detained nationals would be repatriated. This incident follows a statement by Donald Trump emphasizing the need for foreign companies in the US to hire and train American workers and adhere to immigration laws.

Donald Trump was booed a

titles: Crowd greets Donald Trump with boos and cheers at US Open men’s final

summary: President Donald Trump attended the U.S. Open men's final between Sinner and Alcaraz in New York, where he received mixed reactions from the crowd, including cheers and boos. The USTA requested broadcasters to avoid showing crowd reactions to Trump's presence.

title: Volkswagen Aims to Boost EV Adoption in Europe with Affordable Pricing Strategy

The luxury EVs, with their big battery packs and fine leather interiors, are all well and good, but if you really want to move the needle on EV adoption, w
titles: Volkswagen targets dominance in Europe with affordable EV push
Volkswagen rounds out new lineup of affordable EVs with ID. Cross concept
summary: The CEO of Volkswagen has announced the company's plan to reinforce its dominance in the European market by making electric vehicles (EVs) more affordable. This strategy aims to boost EV adoption by addressing the cost barrier that has hindered consumers from transitioning from traditional gasoline vehicles to electric ones.

title: Uber to Test Driverless Cars in Germany Next Year with Momenta
snippets: Uber and one of its many robotaxi partners, Momenta, will test fully driverless cars in Germany next year. The news comes as Europe continues to lag behind the US and China in the number of commercially operational robotaxi services. The companies say they will test Level 4 autonomous vehicles in Mu

Momenta is one of 20 global AV partners that Uber has scooped up across its ridehail, delivery, and freight businesses. Uber says those partnerships have already generated an annualized rate of 1.5 million mobility and delivery.
titles: Uber and Momenta will test fully driverless cars in Germany
Uber and Momenta to test autonomous vehicles in Germany in 2026
summary: Uber, in partnership with Momenta, plans to test fully driverless, Level 4 autonomous vehicles in Germany next year, marking a step towards catching up with the US and China in commercial robotaxi services. This initiative is part of Uber's broader strategy, involving 20 global AV partners, aimed at enhancing its ride-hail, delivery, and freight services, which have already achieved an annualized rate of 1.5 million mobility and delivery operations.

He predicts an 'acceleration' in the US economy despite warnings that a delayed ruling could lead to $750 billion-$1 trillion in tariffs being collected.

title: Visible Time Crystal Created; CRISPR Efficiency Tripled
snippets: Physicists at the University of Colorado Boulder have created the first time crystal that humans can actually see, using liquid crystals that swirl into never-ending patterns when illuminated by light. This breakthrough builds on Nobel laureate Frank Wilczek’s 2012 theory of time crystals—structures

Northwestern scientists have developed a new nanostructure that supercharges CRISPR’s ability to safely and efficiently enter cells, potentially unlocking its full power to treat genetic diseases. By wrapping CRISPR’s tools in spherical DNA-coated nanoparticles, researchers tripled gene-editing succ
titles: Scientists just made the first time crystal you can see
Scientists just made CRISPR three times more effective
summary: Physicists at the University of Colorado Boulder have developed the first visible time crystal, which forms endless patterns in liquid crystals under light, advancing Frank Wilczek's 2012 theory. Concurrently, Northwestern scientists have enhanced CRISPR's efficiency and safety in gene editing by encapsulating its components in DNA-coated nanoparticles, tripling its success rate. These innovations mark significant advancements in physics and genetic engineering.
